title: Was it a great blessing that Finland fought and had never been occupied by the Soviet Union? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was no blessing to have the ussr attack Finland illegally, unprovoked and unannounced, however indeed it was a blessing the Finns of the time understood what that attack meant, it was an all out attack to annex all of Finland. Indeed the Finns had to suffer and sacrifice, however had the Finns not defended themselves, they would have lost many more lives and not to mention their way of life as well. As I have stated many times before, if it were not for the heroes of Finland of that time, which was virtually every Finnish person, I would not have had the opportunities in life that I have enjoyed today. It was their heroism that saved their generation and the generations to come. They indeed were the greatest generation for Finland, and we can never forget the price they paid for our freedom!

The USSR never wanted to “occupy” Finland. She had specific claims on the Karelia isthmus and on the border in the Lapland. Other than that, she never claimed anything else. Consider two things: first, Finland fought extremely well, but she had to give the USSR everything they wanted… TWICE (once at the end of the Winter War, and the other at the end of the Continuation war. Second, other than temporarily recovering the territories lost at the Winter War, and of course defending then afterwards, she only fought the Soviets on Soviet soil at Leningrad siege. And she switched sides in 1944. After that, the Soviets contented with having her on the USSR’s sphere of influence. Regards
